column1: '''''orta-''''' is a [[Quenya]] verb meaning "rise, raise, lift up".<ref name=PE17>{{PE
column4: 347}}, p. 426</ref> The form of the past tense is '''''ortane''''' ("lifted up, raised")<ref>{{RGEO
column5: Notes}}, p. 67</ref><ref name=PE17/> when transitive or causative, and '''''oronte''''' ("rose")<ref name=PE17/> when intransitive.

column2: Words, Phrases and Passages]]", the word derives from [[Sundocarme
Latin]] the verb for "rise up" is ''[[Wiktionary:orior
column4: orta]]'' is a feminine form meaning "she who is raised". It is unknown if [[J.R.R. Tolkien
